short_summary: The context is a statement of the annual rateable value of the building and the maintenance of an assessment book in which entries have to be made every official year of all buildings in the city, their rateable value, the names of persons primarily liable for payment of the property tax on such buildings and of the amount for which each building has been assessed.Section 156 provides for the maintenance of an assessment book in which entries have to be made every official year of all buildings in the city, their rateable value, the names of persons primarily liable for payment of the property tax on such buildings and of the amount for which each building has been assessed.Section 167 lays down that the assess ment book need not be prepared every official year but public notices shall be given in accordance with sections 160 to 162 every year and the provisions of the said sections and of sections 163 and 167 shall be applicable each year.These sections lay down a procedure for hearing objections and complaints against entries in the assessment book From these provisions it is clear that the liability for the tax is determined at the beginning of each official year and the tax is an annual one.
question: What is the annual rateable value of the building?
answer: The annual rateable value of the building is the amount which the building was assessed with in the previous year.

short_summary: The context is the property taxes due under section 212 of the Municipal Act The provisions of the Act affording facilities for the discharge of the liability do not in any way affect their true nature and character If the annual liability is not discharged in the manner laid down by section 197, can it be said that the property cannot be sold for recovery of the whole amount due for the year? The answer to this query can only be in the affirmative, i.e., that the proper ty is liable to sale.The claim was that the taxes were not within the ambit of the clause The Court held that the clause was not meant to cover municipal taxes which are made a charge on the property The claim was rejected.
question: Is the claim that the taxes were not within the ambit of the clause?
